intro: Balsamocitrus chevalieri, commonly known as the Chinese balsam tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its bark is smooth and grayish, while its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive citrus-like scent. The flowers are small and white or pale yellow, often clustered in inflorescences.
